properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm; Waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA from 10 to 60 nm
properties.headline: Hazardous Seas Watch issued January 1 at 10:10PM PST until January 4 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Gale Warning, south winds 30 to 35 kt with gusts
to 45 kt with high and very steep seas becoming very high. For
the Hazardous Seas Warning, advisory strength south winds but
with high and very steep seas becoming very high. For the Small
Craft Advisory, high and steep seas around 15 ft at 18 seconds
diminishing to around 10 ft at 14 seconds early Friday, then
increasing. For the Hazardous Seas Watch, very steep seas of 17
to 22 feet at 14 seconds possible.

* WHERE...Advisory conditions for all of the waters into Friday
afternoon. Gales in the outer waters and into the vicinity of
Cape Blanco with Hazardous Seas elsewhere Friday afternoon
through Friday evening. Then Hazardous Seas are possible for all
of the waters Friday evening through Saturday afternoon.

* WHEN...For the Gale Warning and Hazardous Seas Warning, from 1
PM to 10 PM PST Friday. For the Small Craft Advisory, until 1 PM
PST Friday. For the Hazardous Seas Watch, from Friday evening
through Saturday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds and very steep seas could capsize or
damage vessels. Low visibility conditions are expected.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid strong winds and very steep
seas. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST FRIDAY... ...GALE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 10 PM PST FRIDAY... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 10 PM PST FRIDAY... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON
